org.eng.aisp.segmented

Interface ISegmentedLabeledDataWindow<DATA,LDW extends ILabeledDataWindow<DATA>>

  • Type Parameters:
    DATA - the type of data contained in the IDataWindow contained in the ILabeledDataWindow.
    All Superinterfaces:
    ITaggedEntity, Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ISegmentedLabeledDoubleWindow<LDW>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSegmentedLabeledDataWindow, AbstractSegmentedLabeledDoubleWindow, SegmentedSoundRecording

    public interface ISegmentedLabeledDataWindow<DATA,LDW extends ILabeledDataWindow<DATA>>
extends ITaggedEntity, Serializable
    Design for for labeled data window that has labeled and tagged segments defined over it. Each segment is defined with a start and stop offset time and a set of optional labels and tags. Each segment is represented by an instance of LabeledSegmentSpec. An opitonally empty list of such segments is available.

    Note that this is a container for the segments and the labeled window and does not itself implement ILabeledDataWindow. This is designed this way to help avoid unintentionally using (i.e. training on) the whole segment instead of segments that might be defined on it. That said, implementations should provide the whole labeled data window if no segments are defined.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      LDW getEntireLabeledDataWindow()
      Get the full labeled data window w/o any segmentation.
      List<LDW> getSegmentedLabeledDataWindows()

      • getSegmentSpecs

        List<LabeledSegmentSpec> getSegmentSpecs()
        Get the list of segment specifications, if any.
        Returns:
        never null, but perhaps empty if no segments are defined.

      • getSegmentedLabeledDataWindows

        List<LDW> getSegmentedLabeledDataWindows()
                                  throws AISPException
        Get all the segments defined on this instance. If no segments are defined, then the returned segment is effectively the whole labeled data window.
        Returns:
        never null and never empty.
        Throws:
        AISPException
